poem:
Title: Embers of the Vagrant's Cry

Amidst storied stones
an echo withers—
Halting, the 1824 Act.
Fortune tellers swept into 
a broom's rough hug—
Prostitutes and paupers sucked in,
paper-thin.
Exposing or otherwise,
this old Tory whisper
that chills in 
the crimson marrow of years.
Oh, to strip the axe,
and leave wound bare.
Let fall the cruel reign,
as a rain of understanding.
